com.henrikhedberg.util

Class SelectorLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.henrikhedberg.util.SelectorLoop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TcpServer

    public class SelectorLoop
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A loop around the Selector. Handlers for accepting, connecting, reading and writing may be registered for SelectableChannels.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      • handleException

        public java.io.IOException handleException()
        Clears and returns the IOException caught in the run() loop.
        Returns:
        caught exception or null if no exception

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the loop. If an IOException is caught, the loop is interrupted and the exception is saved. The loop cannot be restarted before the exception is cleared with handleException().
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the loop. It may be restarted again.
